unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Quality Control Initiatives Ramp Up at Tata Steel Plants**
normalised: **Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Quality Control Initiatives Ramp Up at Tata Steel Plants**

unnormalised: Jamshedpur, Jharkhand - Tata Steel has announced a significant investment in bolstering quality control measures across its manufacturing facilities, particularly in the Jamshedpur and Kalinganagar plants. Dr. Anjali Sharma, Head of Quality Assurance, stated the move aims to minimize defects and improve customer satisfaction.
normalised: Jamshedhedpur, Jharkhand - Tata Steel has announced a significant investment in bolstering quality control measures across its manufacturing facilities, particularly in the Jamshedpur and Kalinganagar plants. Doctor Anjali Sharma, Head of Quality Assurance, stated the move aims to minimize defects and improve customer satisfaction.

unnormalised: The initiative includes implementing advanced AI-powered inspection systems that can analyze thousands of sq ft of steel in minutes, detecting even minute imperfections. This builds upon existing Six Sigma methodologies already in place.
normalised: The initiative includes implementing advanced A I-powered inspection systems that can analyze thousands of square feet of steel in minutes, detecting even minute imperfections. This builds upon existing Six Sigma methodologies already in place.

unnormalised: "Our commitment to 'Make in India' includes a dedication to world-class quality," explained a Tata Steel spokesperson. The increased focus on quality control is projected to reduce material wastage by 15% and save the company approximately Rs. 50 Crore annually. The program includes extensive training for all factory floor personnel, reinforcing the importance of quality at every stage of the manufacturing process, from raw material inspection to final product dispatch. The first phase roll-out is expected by Q4 2024.
